clusters.title: Burnt-out car found after man killed in Sydney's second public shooting in days
clusters.neutral_headline: Man Killed in Sydney Shooting, Car Found Burnt
bullet_summary: The burning car found is believed to be linked to the shooting death of a man in Sydney's west
The man was shot in a car last night, with the car later found to be set alight

items.title: Burnt-out car found after man killed in Sydney's second public shooting in days
items.standfirst: The burning car found is believed to be linked to the shooting death of a man in Sydney's west.
items.content: A burnt-out car found by police is believed to be linked to the shooting death of a 22-year-old man in Sydney's west last night.Emergency services were called to Regiment Grove in Winston Hills about 7pm yesterday after the man was shot in the chest while in a car.After the man was shot, he attempted to seek aid from nearby homes but became unresponsive before emergency services arrived.READ MORE: Netanyahu launches extraordinary personal attack on AlbaneseParamedics treated him and rushed him to Westmead Hospital but he later died.One teenager said she saw the police lights from her bedroom window before heading out onto the street with her father."I saw a policeman taping off the road and a man on a stretcher being pulled up into an ambulance with a gunshot wound in his chest," she said, describing him as "not well".David, another resident, said he was "very surprised" to have something like this take police in his neighbourhood."[I'm] very worried. It's a nice area. I have my kids here," he said."They go to school in the area, and it's a really nice area and I'm just, yeah, very concerned about it."READ MORE: Plane forced to land in Italy after flames erupt mid-airAt about 11.15pm emergency services were called to Bounty Place in Old Toongabbie following reports of a fire.Police arrived on the scene and found a Toyota SUV in flames.The blaze was extinguished and no injuries were reported.Crime scenes were established at both locations, which are believed to be linked. No perpetrators of the shooting have been found, though investigation and searches are ongoing.It's the second fatal public shooting in Sydney in a matter of days, following the Forest Lodge pub attack that killed Gilbert Admon Shino, 39, and left Maradona Yalda, 31, needing surgery.There's no information to suggest the two shootings are linked.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.title: Bruce Lehrmann in new bid to clear name after defamation loss
clusters.neutral_headline: Bruce Lehrmann Appeals Defamation Ruling

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann in new bid to clear name after defamation loss
items.standfirst: T he former political staffer will have three days to convince an appeals court to toss out findings he likely raped his colleague Brittany Higgins.
items.content: Bruce Lehrmann will have three days to convince an appeals court to toss out findings he likely raped his colleague Brittany Higgins in Parliament House.The former federal political staffer is seeking to overturn a Federal Court judgment he was not defamed by Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson during an interview with Higgins on The Project in 2021.Justice Michael Lee found Higgins' claims she had been raped in Parliament House in 2019 were substantially true in a ruling against Lehrmann last April.READ MORE: Young kids hide, man dies in childcare centreBut Lehrmann, 29, claims the judgment was rife with errors and launched an appeal which will be ventilated over three days, beginning today in Sydney.The ex-Liberal staffer alleges he was denied procedural fairness because the events found by the judge were "starkly different" from the case run by Ten.He points to the allegation Higgins had repeatedly said "no on a loop" during the alleged incident, which Justice Lee was not satisfied had occurred.The case, as found by Justice Lee, wasn't put to him during cross-examination for his response, Lehrmann argues.He says because of deficiencies in Higgins' evidence, the judge should not have found he engaged in rape.READ MORE: Australia hurtling towards hidden crisisThe judge found Lehrmann had been "hell-bent" on having sex with Higgins and had a mindset of "non-advertent recklessness" which showed he knew she was not consenting.But that definition of rape has been criticised by Lehrmann, who claims it's inconsistent with the meaning conveyed to an ordinary person.Justice Lee is also accused of erring by finding Lehrmann would only be entitled to damages of $20,000 if he had succeeded in his defamation suit against Ten.Lehrmann's lawyer Zali Burrows has previously said he should be awarded a seven-figure sum for the "false charge of rape".Lehrmann continues to deny he sexually assaulted Higgins and a criminal case against him in 2022 was abandoned without any findings against him."Having escaped the lions' den, Mr Lehrmann made the mistake of going back for his hat," Justice Lee said in his decision last year.Readers seeking support can contact 1800 RESPECT on 1800 737 732.National Sexual Abuse and Redress Support Service 1800 211 028

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann re-enters 'lion's den' to appeal against defamation ruling
items.standfirst: The main target of Mr Lehrmann's challenge is the finding that — on the balance of probabilities — he did rape his former colleague Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in Canberra in 2019.
items.content: The main target of Mr Lehrmann's challenge is the finding that — on the balance of probabilities — he did rape his former colleague Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in Canberra in 2019.

ai_summary: Bruce Lehrmann is appealing a defamation ruling.
He is seeking to overturn findings against him.
He has three days to convince an appeals court.
The ruling found he likely raped Brittany Higgins.
The case involves events at Parliament House in 2019.

clusters.title: Eddie Obeid leaves prison on parole
clusters.neutral_headline: Eddie Obeid Released from Prison on Parole

items.title: Eddie Obeid leaves prison on parole
items.standfirst: Disgraced former NSW government minister Eddie Obeid has left prison on parole this morning.
items.content: Disgraced former NSW government minister Eddie Obeid has left prison on parole this morning.

items.title: Eddie Obeid leaves prison on parole
items.standfirst: T he former NSW government minister was jailed in 2021 over a coal exploration licence conspiracy.
items.content: Disgraced former NSW politician Eddie Obeid has walked from Long Bay prison this morning after he was paroled to serve the rest of his sentence in the community.Obeid, 81, a former NSW Labor government minister and powerbroker, was sentenced in 2021 to seven years in jail over a coal exploration licence conspiracy that also involved his son Moses and former NSW State Resources Minister Ian Macdonald.Eddie Obeid's sentence carried a non-parole period of three years and 10 months, which expires today.READ MORE: Millions warned downpour to persist, flooding possibleIn a statement, the State Parole Authority said Obeid would be released under strict conditions and be subject to supervision.Obeid is barred from engaging in any activity involving the control of money or assets of other people or organisations.He also cannot contact, communicate or associate with co-offenders, excluding his son Moses, without the approval of his parole officer. READ MORE: Two more teens charged over Sydney house party stabbingThe parole order, unless revoked, expires on October 20, 2028.Obeid, his son, and Macdonald were found guilty of conspiring for Macdonald to engage in misconduct between 2007 and 2009.Macdonald was found to have provided confidential information to the Obeids over a coal exploration licence that delivered a $30 million windfall to their family.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: Former NSW government minister Eddie Obeid was released.
He was released from prison on parole.
Obeid was jailed in 2021.
He was jailed over a coal exploration licence conspiracy.
Obeid was a disgraced former minister.

clusters.title: Plane forced to land in Italy after flames erupt mid-air
clusters.neutral_headline: Plane Makes Emergency Landing After Mid-Air Fire

items.title: Plane forced to land in Italy after flames erupt mid-air
items.standfirst: V ideo on social media showed fire flaring near the plane engine as it flew.
items.content: A passenger plane has been forced to make an emergency landing in Italy after flames erupted mid-flight.Condor Airlines said a "reaction" near the engine had caused flames to appear, but stopped short of describing it as an engine fire.The plane landed in Brindisi after taking off from Corfu on Saturday night, local time.READ MORE: Trump rules out sending US troops to Ukraine as part of peace deal None of the 273 passengers and eight crew on board were injured.CBS News reported the plane was headed from Greece to Germany before the emergency landing. Video on social media showed flames flashing on the plane's wing. Passengers waited overnight for a replacement aircraft which carried them to Dusseldorf in Germany the next day. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone.
